body_content.explanation: a number of similar or related events or things, one following another:
examples: There has been a series of sexual attacks on women in the area.
She gave a series of lectures at Warwick University last year on contemporary British writers.

body_content.explanation: a number of games played one after another by two teams against each other:
examples: The Yankees have a four-game series against the Orioles at home.

body_content.explanation: Parts of an electrical system that are in series are arranged in a single line so that the current flows through each part, one after another:
examples: If two bulbs are in series, there is a single conducting path.

body_content.explanation: a set of television or radio broadcasts on the same subject or using the same characters but in different situations:
examples: The star is to host a television series on extreme sports.
I missed the second episode of the series so I don't know what's going on now.

body_content.explanation: a set of books published by the same company that deal with the same subject:
examples: They do a series on architecture throughout the ages.
